intro: Silene otites var. umbellata, commonly known as the umbellate campion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its erect, slender stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Silene otites var. umbellata is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a characteristic species of certain ecological communities.
